snippet: Federal investigators said Tuesday that thousands of doctors and other health care providers had signed up to bill Medicare using “questionable addresses” like mailbox rental stores and vacant lots.
abstract: Government Accountability Office investigators say thousands of doctors and health care providers have used 'questionable' addresses to bill Medicare and that Medicare has not verified addresses adequately; warn that invalid addresses could indicate fraud.
lead_paragraph: Federal investigators said Tuesday that thousands of doctors and other health care providers had signed up to bill Medicare using “questionable addresses” like mailbox rental stores and vacant lots.

headline.main: Federal Report Says Many Doctors Use False Addresses for Medicare
headline.print_headline: Federal Report Says Many Doctors Use False Addresses for Medicare
